attributes.action: make 23 April, St Georges Day, a bank holiday in England.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
England is at the bottom of the table for Bank Holidays in Europe. We only get 8, but countries like Spain and Portugal get 12-14 days off - even the workaholic Americans get 13 bank holidays!

And why is Northern Ireland given a day off on St. Patrick's Day, but England is not allowed to celebrate St Georges Day?

It's simply not fair and needs to change.

There is a growing demand for a bank holiday in England on St. George's Day - England's National Day.

This would be a great opportunity for all the English - regardless of colour or religion - to recognise what binds us together.

We have the richest culture and heritage in the world, lets have a day to recognise the fact.
